title: Akaliza Keza Ntwari writes on women-led innovation - Fondation Botnar

quotes: Fit4Future concluded its Phase 1 (2020–2024), which prioritised preventive health, inclusive learning, and participatory city solutions.

As the programme transitions into Phase 2 in 2025, it builds on the success of 14 groundbreaking projects that fostered youth leadership, multi-stakeholder collaboration, and public-private partnerships, generating remarkable outcomes that demonstrate its far-reaching impact.
In 2024, AI&Me made significant strides in improving road safety in Vietnam.

organizations.name: Fit4Future
quotes: Fit4Future concluded its Phase 1 (2020–2024), which prioritised preventive health, inclusive learning, and participatory city solutions.

organizations.name: Ghana Science & Tech Explorer Prize (GSTEP)
quotes: The Ghana Science and Tech Explorer Prize (GSTEP) continues to inspire young Ghanaians as future inventors and problem-solvers.

organizations.name: AI&Me
quotes: The AI&Me: Empowering Youth for Safer Roads programme is revolutionising road safety measures across Vietnam by harnessing the power of technology and youth engagement.

organizations.name: Safetipin
quotes: Leveraging technology to promote safer urban spaces, the Cities for Youth programme supports young people, particularly young women, in advocating for safe, accessible public spaces.

organizations.name: Google.org
quotes: The programme received the prestigious Prince Michael International Road Safety Award and secured a USD 2 million Google.org grant to expand it nationwide and adapt its innovations globally.

quotes: Inspiring Ghana’s next generation of entrepreneurs and inventors

roles.title: teachers
quotes: During Phase 1, GSTEP supported over 30,000 students, and 2400 teachers from more than 1100 schools to tackle real-world challenges.

leading to the establishment of 30 km/h zones around schools in Pleiku – the first city in Vietnam to implement such measures.
Creating safer, inclusive urban spaces in India
starting with a pilot in four cities in Rajasthan: Ajmer, Jaipur, Jodhpur, and Udaipur.
